title: Decade-High Mortgage Rates Pose Threat to Spring Housing Market
sub_head: Demand remains strong, but borrowing rates are climbing at fastest pace in years
body:
U.S. housing sales are heating up again this spring, but the highest mortgage rates in more than a decade threaten to cool the sales pace that has gripped the market for nearly two years.
Home sales rose last year to the highest level since 2006 as the Covid-19 pandemic changed consumersâ€™ housing priorities and remote work enabled people to move farther from work.
